block.p: An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
MUSIC

An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
MUSIC

ACCESS TO ART Summer Chamber Music Festival Access 2000 presents a concert with the Mondrian Ensemble Philadelphia Orchestra Musicians and a Beethoven String trio performance by Michael Ludwig, violinist; Melissa Kleinbart, violinist/violist; and John Koen, cellist. Saturday at 8:30 p.m. St. Paul's R. C. Church, 9910 3rd Avenue, Stone Harbor. Tickets: $15; $12 for students and older people. (609) 368-8100.
BAIRD CENTER Outdoor Concert Series featuring New York Percussion Group. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Meadowland Park, North Ridgewood Road, South Orange. Free. 5 Mead Street, South Orange. (973) 378-7754.
BEACHWOOD PARK The Waldwick Band performs light classics, Broadway selections and marches. Tuesday at 8:30 p.m. Free. Hillsdale Avenue, Hillsdale. (201) 664-2939
BICKFORD THEATER The Wolverines. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15. Morris Museum, 6 Normandy Heights Road, Morristown. (973) 538-0454.

CHALFONTE HOTEL ''Concerts by Candlelight'' Children's Concert featuring String Variations. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. in the Henry Sawyer Room. Tickets: $7, or free with dinner. ''La Dolce Vita'' cabaret of movie songs of the 1960's, featuring Jilline Ringle. Wednesday through Aug. 20. Tickets: $20; $18 for students and older people; $8 for children under 12. 301 Howard Street, Cape May. (609) 884-8409.
CONCERTS IN THE PARK Saturday Night Fever. Tuesday at 7:15 p.m. Free. Wilson Park, Linden.
THE CORNERSTONE Rio Clemente Trio with Bob Miller. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. George Anders Quartet. Friday at 9 p.m. Ray Alexander Quartet. Saturday at 9 p.m. 25 New Street, Metuchen. (732) 549-5306.
CROSSWICKS FRIENDS MEETING Le Triomphe de l'Amour, New Jersey's chamber ensemble, will perform music of the Baroque on period instruments. Saturday at 8 p.m. Free. 15 Front Street. (609) 730-8796.
FAIR LAWN SUMMER MUSIC FESTIVAL Bucky Pizzarelli and his Friends. Tonight at 8:30 p.m. Free. Memorial Park, Berdan Avenue, Fair Lawn. (201) 796-6746.
KASSCHAU MEMORIAL SHELL Andy Cooney, performing ''Galway Bay'' and ''Danny Boy,'' and other tunes. Tuesday at 8:30 p.m. Free. Veterans Field, North Maple Avenue, Ridgewood. (201) 444-0776.

MAHWAH PUBLIC LIBRARY Summer Music Festival presents Yuko Naito, violinist, in recital. Tuesday at 7 p.m. ''From Bach to Bartok,'' featuring the students of the Academy of Music Summer Festival. Wednesday at 7 p.m. Free. 100 Ridge Road, Mahwah. (201) 529-7323.

NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER Amadeus Festival 2000 with Vladimir Feltsman performing Mozart's Piano Concerto No. 24. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15, $30 and $45. Prudential Hall. ''Absolut Sounds of the City 2000,'' outdoor music series. Thursday evenings, 5 to 10 o'clock, through Aug. 31. Positive Rhythmic Force, jazz; Neto, Brazilian music; and Les Go, African and international pop. ''Rhythm of Love Summer 2000 Tour,'' featuring Will Downing, Chante Moore, Gerald Albright and Phil Perry. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $30, $45 and $55. Theater Square. 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.
NEWARK'S NEIGHBORHOOD SUMMER CONCERT SERIES Franklin Munoz. Saturday at 2 p.m. Independence Park, Van Buren and Walnut Streets. Free. (973) 733-6454.
NORTH WILDWOOD SUMMER SERIES Main Stage Harmony Group. Thursday at 8 p.m. The Shirelles. Saturday at 8 p.m. North Wildwood's amphitheater, Ocean and Second Avenues. Free. (609) 889-2241.

OCEAN GROVE SUMMER CONCERT SERIES Through Sept. 9. Roger Sayer, organist. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m and Saturday at noon. Free. Dionne Warwick. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $28 (reserved); $23 (general admission). The Great Auditorium, Ocean Grove. (732) 988-0645.
PALISADES INTERSTATE PARK COMMISSION Summer Outdoor Concert Series with the Eddie Hazel Trio. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Free. ($4 parking charge.) Alpine Picnic Area, Alpine Pavilion. (201) 768-0379.

PNC BANK ARTS CENTER Ozzfest 2000. Tomorrow at 10:20 a.m. Tickets: $45.25 to $70.25. WRAT 95.9 Ratfest featuring Def Leppard. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $30.50 and $40.50. Third Eye Blind. Saturday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $22.75 and $28.75. Exit 116, off the Garden State Parkway, Holmdel. (201) 507-8900.

PRINCETON UNIVERSITY RICHARDSON AUDITORIUM The Whitman String Quartet. Tuesday at 8 p.m. Free; tickets required. New Jersey Symphony Orchestra Amadeus Festival 2000. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15 to $45. Alexander Hall, Princeton. (609) 258-5000.

RAMAPO COLLEGE Minolta Summer Music Festival. Thursdays through July. The Tommy Gryce Quartet. Thursday at 8 p.m. Free admission; parking is $5 a car. Band Shell, Ramapo College, 505 Ramapo Valley Road, Mahwah. (201) 684-7611.
REGGAE ROOTS 2000 Concert featuring Shayar and K'Rooshal Force, Afaya and Stormy. Wednesday at 5:30 p.m. Nishuane Park, Harrison and Orange Road, Montclair. (973) 509-4590.
ST. ELIZABETH'S COLLEGE Masterwork Chorus presents ''Summer Sings,'' featuring Poulenc's Gloria and Faure's Requiem. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $8. Route 124, Convent Station. (973) 455-7008.

SHANGHAI JAZZ The John Pizzarelli Trio. Tuesday and Wednesday at 7 p.m. Bill Charlap, pianist. Thursday at 7 p.m. Steve Turee Quartet. Friday at 6:45 p.m. and 8:30 p.m.;Saturday at 6:30 p.m. and 8:45 p.m. No cover; $15 to $25 minimum. 24 Main Street, Madison. (973) 822-2899.

SOMERSET COUNTY PARK COMMISSION 5th Annual Bayou Fest, featuring the VooDUDES, Wayne Toups and Zydecajun. Tonight at 7 p.m. Free. Duke Island Park bandshell, across from Visitor's Center. (908) 722-1200, ext. 351.

STANHOPE HOUSE Addison Groove Project and Uncle Sammy. Today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $8. Juggling Suns. Thursday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $7. Billy Hector and the Fairlanes. Friday at 10 p.m. Tickets: $6. Laurie Cagno and Friends. Saturday at 10 p.m. Tickets: $7. 45 Main Street, Stanhope. (973) 347-0458.
TIERNEY'S TAVERN Diane Moser's Big Band, featuring Melissa Walker, vocalist. Wednesday, 8 p.m. to 11 p.m. Tickets: $7. 138 Valley Road, Montclair. (973) 744-9785.

WILLIAM PATERSON UNIVERSITY ''Jazz It Up!'' Festival featuring James Williams, jazz pianist, and other performers like Conrad Herwig, Byron Stripling, Frank Weiss and Marlene VerPlanck. Tomorrow through Friday at 7:30 p.m.; Saturday's concert is a Jazz Improvisational Workshop at 1 p.m. Free. Summer Choir Concert featuring ''Gloria'' choruses, a medley of Duke Ellington songs. Next Sunday at 7:30 p.m. Free. Shea Center for Performing Arts, 300 Pompton Road, Wayne. (973) 720-3128.
THEATER

BANANAS COMEDY CLUB Jim Florentine, with Dan O'Brien and Dori Sullivan. Friday at 9:30 p.m.; Saturday at 8:30 p.m. and 10:45 p.m. Tickets: $10 on Friday; $12 on Saturday. Holiday Inn, 283 Route 17 South, Hasbrouck Heights. (201) 727-1090.
CIRCLE PLAYERS ''Pippin.'' Through Aug. 5. Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m. and Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $13; $12 for Sunday matinees. 416 Victoria Avenue, Piscataway. (732) 968-7555.
DUNCAN SMITH THEATER The Holmdel Theater Company in ''Twelfth Night.'' Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15. Crawfords Corner Road, Holmdel. (732) 946-0427.

GARRIS CENTER THEATER ''Sylvia,'' A. R. Gurney's comedy performed by Tri-State Actors Theater. Through Aug. 6. Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15; $13 for students and older people and Sunday matinees; $11 for students and older people for Sunday matinees. 6 Broad Street, Branchville. (888) 840-7889.
JOHN HARMS CENTER FOR THE ARTS Damon Wayans, comedian. Saturday at 7 p.m. and 9:30 p.m. Tickets: $18 to $38. 30 North Van Brunt Street, Englewood. (201) 567-3600.
HUDSON SHAKESPEARE COMPANY ''Othello.'' Tomorrow at 7 p.m. Free. Pier a Park, River Road and First Street, Hoboken. (201) 420-2207.
IRON MOUNTAIN STAGE COMPANY ''H.M.S. Pinafore'' or ''The Lass That Loved a Sailor.'' Today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $12. Community Presbyterian Church, 145 Carletondale Road, Ringwood. (973) 962-9007.

LEONIA HIGH SCHOOL LITTLE THEATER Summerfest at Leonia featuring ''The Wizard of Oz.'' Today and next Sunday at 3 p.m.; Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15; $12 for children and older people. 100 Christie Heights Street, Leonia. (201) 242-8787.

LONG BEACH ISLAND FOUNDATION OF THE ARTS AND SCIENCES ''Artful Lives: Living Portraits of Georgia O'Keeffe and Frida Kahlo,'' one-woman play performed by Robin Lane. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $8. 120 Long Beach Boulevard, Loveladies. (609) 494-1241, extension 300.

LUMIA THEATER ''The Girl With the High Rouge,'' Vincent Sessa's surreal comic-drama, performed by the New Jersey Repertory Company. Thursday through Aug. 20. Thursdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $25; $35 for July 28, including reception. 179 Broadway, Long Branch. (732) 229-3166.

MANALAPAN-ENGLISHTOWN MIDDLE SCHOOL ''Man of La Mancha,'' performed by Manalapan Community Players. Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m.; next Sunday at 2 p.m.; Aug. 4 and 5 at 8 p.m. Tickets: $10 at the door; $8 in advance. 155 Millhurst Road, Manalapan. (732) 446-3007.
McCARTER THEATER Opera Festival of New Jersey. Frank Lewin's ''Burning Bright.'' Today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $22 to $82. Center for the Performing Arts, 91 University Place, Princeton. (609) 258-2787.

MONTCLAIR STATE UNIVERSITY TheaterFest, the Professional Equity Theater-in-Residence in ''High Spirits,'' starring Kim Zimmer. Through Aug. 6. Performances Tuesdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 3 p.m.; Wednesday matinees at 2 p.m. Tickets: $35; $28 for older people. Valley Road and Normal Avenue, Upper Montclair. (973) 655-5112.

MONMOUTH UNIVERSITY Brian Friel's ''Translations,'' as the final production of the Shadow Lawn Summer Stage series. Today and Wednesday through next Sunday. All performances at 8 p.m. except for the two Sunday shows, which begin at 7 p.m. Tickets: $9, $12 and $15. Lauren K. Woods Theater, Cedar Avenue, West Long Branch. (732) 263-5730.

NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER Summer Youth Performance Workshop in ''Brigadoon.'' Today and next Sunday at 2 p.m.; Thursday at 12:30 p.m.; Friday and Saturday at 7 p.m. Victoria Theater. 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.

NEW JERSEY SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL ''Twelfth Night.'' Tuesdays through Fridays at 8 p.m., Saturdays at 2 p.m and 8 p.m., Sundays at 2 p.m. and 7 p.m. Through July 30. Tickets: $21 to $38. F. M. Kirby Shakespeare Theater, 36 Madison Avenue, Madison. (973) 408-5600.

OLDWICK COMMUNITY PLAYERS ''Dirty Work at the Crossroads.'' Through next Sunday. Today and next Sunday at 3 p.m.; Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25 for family; $10 for adults; $8 for students and older people. Today's performance at Fairmont Presbyterian Church Community House, 6.5 miles north of Oldwick on Route 517. Friday through next Sunday will be at the Zion Lutheran Church Christian Education Building, Church Street and Miller Avenue, Oldwick. (908) 832-9189.
PAPER MILL PLAYHOUSE ''Pippin.'' Today at 2 p.m. and 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $36 to $60. Brookside Drive, Millburn. (973) 376-4343.
PEDDIE SCHOOL ''Carnival.'' Saturday and Aug. 5 at 8 p.m.; next Sunday and Aug. 6 at 2 p.m. Tickets: $15. William Mount-Burke Theater, South Main Street, Hightstown. (609) 490-7550.

PRINCETON REP SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL ''A Midsummer Night's Dream.'' Today at 7 p.m. Free. Performances are at Pettoranello Gardens, Mountain Avenue and Route 206, Community Park North, Princeton. (609) 688-0381 or (609) 921-3682.

THEATER UNDER THE STARS ''Guys and Dolls.'' Friday through Aug. 13. Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays at 8 p.m. Free. Degnan Park, next to West Orange High School, Pleasant Valley Way, West Orange. (973) 325-0795.

UNION COUNTY COLLEGE THEATER PROJECT ''Defying Gravity,'' by Jane Anderson. Today at 3 p.m. Tickets: $12; $7 for students and older people. Roy W. Smith Theater, Cranford College Campus, 1033 Springfield Avenue. (908) 659-5189.
VAGABOND PLAYERS ''The Wizard of Oz.'' Today, Saturday and next Sunday at 2 p.m. Tickets: $10 for adults; $8 for children under 12. Shore Hills Country Club, Morse Place, Landing. (973) 398-3565.
MUSEUMS AND GALLERIES

ABC GALLERY ''Mostly Flowers: Oil Paintings and Paper Mosaics by Leila Bakashvili.'' Through Aug. 12. Hours: Mondays and Thursdays, 1 to 9 p.m.; Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Fridays, 1 p.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Lambertville Public Library, 6 Lilly Street, Lambertville. (609) 397-0275.

AFRICAN ART MUSEUM OF THE S.M.A. FATHERS ''Eloquent Threads: The Language of African Costumes and Textiles.'' Through Dec. 31. Hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. 23 Bliss Avenue, Tenafly. (201) 894-8611.

ALBA VINEYARD Diana Gibson: Exhibit of Original Oils. Through July. Hours: Wednesdays, Thursdays, Sundays, noon to 5 p.m.; Fridays, noon to 7 p.m.; Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Musconetcong Gallery, 269 Route 627, Village of Finesville, Milford. (908) 995-7800.

AMERICAN LABOR MUSEUM ''Workers' Portraits,'' photodocumentary exhibit by Robert Gumpert. Through Dec. 31. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; other times by appointment. Botto House National Landmark, 83 Norwood Street, Haledon. (973) 595-7953.
BARRON ARTS CENTER ''Best of Life 2000'' art exhibit. Through next Sunday. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, 2 to 4 p.m. 582 Rahway Avenue, Woodbridge. (732) 634-0413.

B. BEAMESDERFER GALLERY ''Three New England Artists: J. Ann Eldridge, David Cloutier and Abigail Rorer.'' Through Aug. 5. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 9:30 to 6 p.m.; or by appointment. 6 North Second Avenue, Highland Park. (732) 249-6971.

BERGEN COUNTY JEWISH COMMUNITY CENTER Paintings by Chaim Bezalel and Yonnah Ben Levy, and photography by Ray Turkin of Teaneck. Through next Sunday. Hours: Sundays, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Mondays through Thursdays, 9 a.m. to 9:45 p.m.; Fridays, 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. 605 Pascack Road, Washington Township. (201) 666-6610, extension 222.
BERLEX LABORATORIES CORPORATE HEADQUARTERS ''Beauty: Outside and Inside,'' by Bertha E. Barmakian. Through Sept. 6. By appointment. 340 Changebridge Road, Montville. (973) 276-2000.

CERULEAN FINE ARTS GALLERY ''New Works,'' a summer membership show, with paintings in all media, sculpture and photography. Through Sept. 2. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 11:30 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Saturdays, 4 to 9 p.m. Headquarters Plaza Mall, Speedwell Avenue (Route 202), Morristown. (973) 267-3730.

CLEOPATRA STEPS OUT GALLERY ''Hang 10,'' fine crafts, home accessories, paintings and photography by 10 contemporary artists. Through Sept. 2. Hours: Thursdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Mondays through Wednesdays by appointment. 721 Cookman Avenue, Asbury Park. (732) 774-6306.

EXTENSION GALLERY Ayami Aoyama's ''Sculpture, Paintings and Drawings.'' Through Aug. 3. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; other times by appointment. 60 Ward Avenue Extension, Mercerville. (609) 890-7777.

GALLERY ONE MAIN ''Summertime Hues,'' featuring members of the New Jersey Water color Society and members of the Garden State Watercolor Society. Through August. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. Route 513, Highbridge. (908) 638-3838.

GREAT BAY GALLERY Exhibit by Peter Gehring, ''Linear Scapes -- Works on Canvas and Paper.'' Through August. Artist's reception: Saturday, 5 p.m. to 8 p.m. Hours: Thursdays and Fridays, 1 to 8 p.m.; Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 9 p.m.; Sundays, 11 a.m. to 7 p.m. 829 Bay Avenue, Somers Point. (609) 653-4991.

GROUNDS FOR SCULPTURE ''Summer 2000 Exhibition.'' Through Sept. 10. Hours: Thursdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Tuesday and Wednesday by appointment. 18 Fairgrounds Road, Hamilton Township. (609) 586-0616.

JERSEY CITY MUSEUM ''The Prints of a Sculptor,'' by Melvin Edwards. Through Oct. 7. Hours: Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays, 10:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Wednesdays, 10:30 a.m.to 8 p.m. 472 Jersey Avenue, Jersey City. (201) 547-4514.
JOHNSON & JOHNSON HEADQUARTERS GALLERY ''Accumulative Strokes,'' paintings by Tony Khawam. Through Aug. 24. Call for appointment only. 1 Johnson and Johnson Plaza, New Brunswick. (732) 524-6957.

LAUREL TRACEY GALLERY Summer Sculpture Series featuring works by Don Bonham, Don Harger, Michael Malpass and Jon Peters. Through Aug. 19. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Sundays, 12:30 p.m. to 4:30 p.m. 10 White Street, Red Bank. (732) 224-0760.

LONG BEACH ISLAND FOUNDATION OF THE ARTS AND SCIENCES ''National Juried Competition.'' Through Aug. 2. ''Foundation Faculty Exhibition.'' Through Sept. 6. ''2000 Craft Gallery.'' Through Oct. 15. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. 120 Long Beach Boulevard, Loveladies. (609) 494-1241, extension 300.

MAKEREADY PRESS GALLERY ''Hilltop Images'' photographic images by Mike Peters. Through Aug. 12. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Saturdays, 1 p.m. to 4 p.m. Gallery 214, 214 Glenridge Avenue, Montclair. (973) 744-8290.

MARSHA CHILD CONTEMPORARY ''Art and the Female Form.'' Through Aug. 30. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; other times by appointment. 220 Alexander Street, Princeton. (609) 497-7330.

MONMOUTH MUSEUM ''New Jersey's Pinelands: Water in the Balance.'' Through Sept. 3. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Admission: $4. 761 Newman Springs Road, Lincroft. (732) 747-2266.

MONTCLAIR ART MUSEUM ''Croquet: The Art of Play.' Through Oct. 15. Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 7 p.m.; Sept. 9 through Oct. 15, course will be open Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Admission: $7; $4 for children. ''Untamed Spirits: Animal Imagery in Native American Art.'' Through next Sunday. Will Barnet: A Timeless World. Through Aug. 20. Hours: Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Admission: $5; $4 for older people and students; free for members and children under 12. 3 South Mountain Avenue, Montclair. (973) 746-5555.

MORRIS COUNTY HISTORICAL SOCIETY ''1900,'' exhibit of photos, products and objects. Through September. Hours: Mondays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Admission: $4; $2 for students. Acorn Hall, 68 Morris Avenue, Morristown. (973) 267-3465.

NEW JERSEY HISTORICAL SOCIETY ''History's Mysteries,'' interactive exhibition. Through July. ''Dining In, Dining Out,'' featuring photographs, video clips, rare silverware, period furniture and 18th-century cookbooks. Through summer 2001. ''Pride of Newark: Baseball's Bears and Eagles,'' about the history of baseball in Newark. Through summer 2001. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. 52 Park Place, Newark. (973) 596-8500.

NEW JERSEY STATE MUSEUM ''Forgotten Gateway: The Abandoned Buildings of Ellis Island, Photographs by Larry Racioppo.'' Through next Sunday. ''Building a Collection: Fine Art at the New Jersey State Museum.'' Through Aug. 20. ''Leah Phyfer Sloshberg Collection of Fine Art.'' Through Sept. 3. ''The Art of Jack Delano.'' Through Sept. 4. ''Of Rock and Fire.'' On extended view. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 4:45 p.m.; Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Free. 205 West State Street, Trenton. (609) 292-6464.

NEWARK MUSEUM ''Wetlands.'' Through Sept. 17. ''2000 New Jersey Fine Arts Annual: Into the Millennium.'' Through Sept. 17. ''Shell Angelology.'' Through next Sunday. ''Year of the Dragon: The Calligraphy of Wang Fangyu.'' Through Nov. 12. ''Needless Necessity: Jewelry, Silver and Personal Meaning.'' Through December. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m.; Thursdays (after hours) until 8:30 p.m. 49 Washington Street, Newark. (973) 596-6550.

NOYES MUSEUM OF ART Inspired by Nature series, featuring ''Recreating Flowers: The Glass Wonders of Paul J. Stankard.'' Through Sept. 3. ''Capturing the Jersey Shore: Works of Anthony J. Rudisill.'' Through Sept. 10. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Admission: $3; $2 for older people and students. Lily Lake Road, Oceanville. (609) 652-8848.

PATERSON MUSEUM ''Up on Two Wheels: A Look Back at Motorcycling in North Jersey,'' show includes antique, classic, military, police, American, Japanese and European models. Through Sept. 24. ''Pair of Progenitors: The Art of Don Kommit and Joe Ruffilo.'' Through Sept. 2. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 12:30 to 4:30 p.m. 2 Market Street, Paterson. (973) 881-3839.

PEDERSEN GALLERY ''Painters of the Jersey shore, 1860-1940.'' Saturday through Aug. 22. Hours: Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m., or by appointment. 17 North Union Street, Lambertville. (609) 397-1332.

PRINCETON UNIVERSITY ART MUSEUM ''The Dawn of Maya Kings: An Early Maya Stela.'' Through next Sunday. Photographs by Barbara Bosworth. Through Sept. 3. ''Flora and Fauna in Chinese Painting.'' Through next Sunday. ''Yayoi Kusama: Early Drawings From the Collection of Richard Castellane.'' Through next Sunday. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Princeton campus. (609) 258-3788.

PRINTMAKING COUNCIL OF NEW JERSEY ''26th Annual Members' Juried Exhibition: Prints, photography, digital work, juried by the artist Arie Galles.'' Through Aug. 26. Hours: Wednesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays, 1 to 4 p.m. 440 River Road, North Branch. (908) 725-2110.

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY - NEW BRUNSWICK ''Folkways and Politics: Halina Rusak -- Artist, Librarian and Scholar.'' Through Aug. 31. Hours: while school in session Mondays through Thursdays, 8 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Fridays, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Mabel Smith Douglass Library, Chapel Drive, Douglass College campus, New Brunswick. (732) 932-9407 extension 44.

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY - NEWARK Prints and Drawings by Anaida Hernandez, 1989-1999. Through September. Hours: Monday through Thursday, 8 a.m. to midnight; Friday, 8 a.m. to 7 p.m.; Saturday, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Sunday, noon to 10 p.m. Dana Library, 185 University Avenue, Newark. (973) 353-5900.

SETON HALL UNIVERSITY ''Public Pathways: The Olmsted Legacy,'' a photographic journal by Nancy J. Ori. Through Aug. 18. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Walsh Library Gallery, 400 South Orange Avenue, South Orange. (973) 275-2033.

SPRINGFIELD PUBLIC LIBRARY ''American Paintings'' by Brian J. Dursee. Through Sept. 2. Hours: Mondays, Wednesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 8:30 p.m.; Tuesdays and Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Donald B. Palmer Museum, 66 Mountain Avenue, Springfield. (973) 376-4930.

WATCHUNG ARTS CENTER ''Subrosa'' group display works. Through Aug. 7. ''The Understanding and Misunderstanding of Animals'' art show. Through next Sunday. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 1 to 4 p.m. 18 Sterling Road, Watchung. (908) 753-0190.

WHEATON VILLAGE ''American Glass: 1900-2000,'' featuring more than 100 industrial and decorative pieces. Through Oct. 22. Hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $7; $6 for older people; $3.50 for students. ''HER,'' multi-media exhibit. Through Aug. 13. No admission charge to the Gallery of American Craft. Exit 26, Route 55, Millville. (800) 998-4552, extension 2756.

JAMES YAROSH FINE ART AND DESIGN ''A Russian Fairy Tale: Fine Art of the Former Soviet Union.'' Through August. July's highlighted artist: Edward Yashin. Hours: Saturdays, noon to 4 p.m.; other times by appointment. 55 East Main Street, Holmdel. (732) 332-0056.

YOGI BERRA MUSEUM ''Baseball and Books,'' New Jersey Jackal players read baseball stories aloud to children before Wednesday night home games. Wednesdays at 6 p.m., July 26, August 9, 23 and 30. ''Glove Story,'' interactive exhibit on the evolution of the baseball glove, including 19th-century rare vintage models and hands-on replicas. Through July. Artifacts from the life of the baseball player and exhibits on the history of the Yankees, baseball in New Jersey, Negro Leagues, evolution of equipment, and baseball during World War II. Ongoing. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Tickets: $4; $2 for children. Montclair State University, 8 Quarry Road, Little Falls. (973) 655-2377.
FOR CHILDREN

FLAT ROCK BROOK NATURE CENTER ''Beautiful Butterflies.'' Today, 1:30 p.m. to 3 p.m. Fee: $5. ''Canoe the Hackensack River.'' Wednesday, 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. Fee: $18. 443 Van Nostrand Avenue, Englewood. (201) 567-1265.
FORUM THEATER COMPANY ''Popeye the Sailor.'' Through Saturday. Tuesday and Thursday at 10 a.m.; Wednesday at 1 p.m.; Saturday at 11 a.m. Tickets: $9. 314 Main Street, Metuchen. (732) 548-0582.

KELSEY THEATER ''The Emperor's New Clothes'' performed by the Westminster Conservatory Summer Children's Opera Workshop. Friday at 7:30 p.m.; Saturday at 3 p.m. and 7:30 p.m.; and next Sunday at 3 p.m. Tickets: $5. Mercer County Community College, 1200 Trenton Road, Trenton. (609) 921-7104.

MORRIS COUNTY PARK COMMISSION Preschooler Walks. Wednesday at 9:30 a.m. Fee: $5 per child; pre-registration is required. Great Swamp Outdoor Education Center, 247 Southern Boulevard, Chatham Township. (973) 635-6629.

BARNES & NOBLE Arthur Homme, the son of Marcelle Earle who wrote ''Midnight Frolic: A Ziegfeld Girl's True Story,'' will discuss and sign his mother's book. Thursday at 7 p.m. 753 Route 18, Brunswick Square, East Brunswick. (732) 432-0100.

CONGREGATION KETER TORAH Barbara Kessel, author, will discuss and sign her book, '' Suddenly Jewish: Jews Raised as Gentiles Discover their Jewish Roots.'' Wednesday at 8 p.m. Romer Avenue, Teaneck. (201) 833-1650.

NEWARK MUSEUM Dr. Gordon Shaw, president of the Music Intelligence Neural Development Institute and professor emeritus of physics at the University of California, Irvine, will be the keynote speaker of a program entitled ''Mozart Makes Me Think!,'' presented by the New Jersey Symphony Orchestra. Tomorrow at 7:30 p.m. The program will also include a performance of Mozart's Sonata for Two Pianos. Tickets: $15. Billy Johnson Auditorium, 49 Washington Street, Newark. (800) 255-3476.

NEW JERSEY FESTIVAL OF BALLOONING Friday through next Sunday. Festival will feature balloon ascensions twice daily Saturday and Sunday at 6:30 a.m. and 6:30 p.m. and on Friday at 6:30 p.m.; performances by the Beach Boys, America, the Nerds and Parrotville; Richard Scarry's Busytown Express Tour; E Team, Elvises of the Sky and more. Tickets: on sale at all Quick Chek stores; $15 (advance); $20 (at the gate); $6 for children, 4 to 12 years old; $10 (at the gate). Solberg Airport, Readington. (800) 468-2479.
